item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Didn't he also say that that means that even if you have Shorty Lv. 2, it still doesn't count as there being Shorty Lv. 1 in your party/accessable teammates, and thus he still drops petals at a high rate?

item.title: Would like someone to modify this wikipage...
item.content:encoded: …Since McM confirmed that it is made as such that if Shorty Lv. 1 isn't in your party all forms of Strawberry will drop silver petals more often in a BC Q&A.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I have a feeling it means that Strawberry drops more Silver Petals when you go for Bankai, and you lose Shorty as an ally. Since you're down to only 1 ally capable of dropping Petals and you need 50 to complete the mission.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I keep both on my team and I get a lot of drops. I haven't noticed any increase when I pair him with Orihime. I'd like to see stronger confirmation of this solo enhanced drop. Usually solo bonuses are more unique than that (like how Sakura beats puppets)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Where exactly did McM confirm this? And does that mean when Shorty isn't in your team, or when Adventures on the Other Side takes her away?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: If he drops more petals without shorty on the team, how much more does he drop percentage-wise? If he drops twice as much or more without shorty, than it would be better just using him. But if it's only a slight increase, then I would be better off having him drop less, but also having Shorty so that there are two people dropping them rather than just one.

item.title: Item Drop
item.content:encoded: it COULD just be me, but this is my third season doing this and it seems that whenever you ONLY have strawberry in your party, the chance of him dropping a silver petal shoots through the roof…
